public abstract class ServoMotion<T extends com.kuka.roboticsAPI.motionModel.KROSMotion<T>>
extends com.kuka.roboticsAPI.motionModel.KROSMotion<T>
implements IServoMotion

Base class for servo motions.

ServoMotion

Method Detail

getRuntime

public IServoRuntime getRuntime()
Inquire the runtime information.

Note: It is available after the motion has been activated.

getRuntime() blocks until the system is ready to accept new commands or a timeout is reached. If the last mentioned happens the motion is aborted.

Returns:
the active servoMotion Runtime

getRuntime

public IServoRuntime getRuntime(boolean blocking)
Inquire the runtime information.

Note: It is available after the motion has been activated.

Parameters:
blocking - true if blocking shall be activated. If the blocking is false it is recommended call IServoRuntime.waitForTransferred() of
Returns:
the active servoMotion Runtime

setRuntimeByMapper

public void setRuntimeByMapper(IServoRuntime aRuntime)
Internal set function for the Runtime Information.

Specified by:
setRuntimeByMapper in interface IServoMotion
Parameters:
aRuntime - the runtime created by the corresponding mapper
This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.

useTrace

public T useTrace(boolean active)
Activate tracing. The trace file will be stored on the controller.

Parameters:
active - activate (true) or deactivate (false ) trace
Returns:
self
This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.

validateForImpedanceMode

public static boolean validateForImpedanceMode(com.kuka.roboticsAPI.geometricModel.PhysicalObject theRobotWithTool)
Validate the load parameter setting of the robot once.

The assumption behind: You as application programmer are aware, that the load parameters have to be set properly, AND in this instantaneous snapshot, the parameters are valid.

Note: The validation itself justifies, that in this very time instance, the load parameter setting was sufficient. This does not mean by far, that the parameter setting is valid in the sequel or lifetime of this program. ServoMotionUtilities

Parameters:
theRobotWithTool - the object which shall be validated
Returns:
true if successfully validated
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if not successfully validated

validateForImpedanceMode

public static boolean validateForImpedanceMode(com.kuka.roboticsAPI.deviceModel.Robot theRobot)
Validate the load parameter setting of the robot once.

The assumption behind: You as application programmer are aware, that the load parameters have to be set properly, AND in this instantaneous snapshot, the parameters are valid.

Note: The validation itself justifies, that in this very time instance, the load parameter setting was sufficient. This does not mean by far, that the parameter setting is valid in the sequel or lifetime of this program ServoMotionUtilities

Parameters:
theRobot - the object which shall be validated
Returns:
true if successfully validated
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if not successfully validated

clearImpedanceValidity

Clear the validity flag for impedance.

setTimeoutAfterGoalReach

public T setTimeoutAfterGoalReach(double timeout)
Set motion timeout defaults to 30.0 seconds after reaching the last set destination. As this timeout is reached, the motion itself is stopped. In effect, this timeout behaves like the call to IServoRuntime.stopMotion(). Note: If you like to debug, you can increase this value.

Parameters:
timeout - the timeout in seconds
Returns:
self
See Also:
getTimeoutAfterGoalReach()

setTimeoutAfterGoalReach

public T setTimeoutAfterGoalReach(long timeout,
                                  java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeunit)
Set motion timeout after reaching the last set destination. The default value is 30.0 seconds. As this timeout is reached, the motion itself is stopped. In effect, this timeout behaves like the call to IServoRuntime.stopMotion(). Note: If you like to debug, you can increase this value.

Parameters:
timeout - the timeout
timeunit - the unit of the timeout
Returns:
self
See Also:
getTimeoutAfterGoalReach()

getTimeoutAfterGoalReach

public double getTimeoutAfterGoalReach()
Get the timeout after goal reached.

Returns:
the set timeout in seconds
See Also:
setTimeoutAfterGoalReach(double)

getSpeedTimeoutAfterGoalReach

public double getSpeedTimeoutAfterGoalReach()
Get the current speed timeout after the goal is reached.

Returns:
the timeout in seconds. Default value is 0.0 s.

setMinimumTrajectoryExecutionTime

public T setMinimumTrajectoryExecutionTime(double minTrajecTime)
Set the minimal trajectory execution time.

That means the minimal time to reach the set-point to avoid "stepper motion".
The default value is 0.01 and maximum value is 0.1 seconds.

Parameters:
minTrajecTime - in seconds.
Returns:
itself

getMinimumTrajectoryExecutionTime

public double getMinimumTrajectoryExecutionTime()
Returns the minimum trajectory execution time.

Returns:
minimum trajectory execution time in seconds
See Also:
setMinimumTrajectoryExecutionTime(double)
